intro: Bidens gardullensis, commonly known as the Mexican ironweed, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces yellow flowers with prominent white markings. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soils, often found in grasslands and disturbed areas. Bidens gardullensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits, providing nectar for pollinators.
